review: We were so happy to find this restaurant! We were out for the night and on the way home, realized just how hungry we all were. There were no restaurants that were open in the area, so to find this place was a Godsend! They were able to seat our large party of 15 right away, which was great and impressive because they were busy. Seeing as though they were the only restaurant in the area open, I can see why they would be so busy.  Although they were busy, that did not stop them from giving us excellent service, and to a group of 15 that isn't always easy.  I am always a fan of TGI Fridays. I have been eating here for 20 years. Hence the four instead of five stars. The menu could really use an update. Of course I enjoy their Jack Daniels menu, so please don't get rid of that, however, adding some new and unique items wouldn't hurt. Dine or Dash? If I am in the area, I will Dine. Mostly because it will probably be the only place open.

Well it's currently 7:51 PM on April 25th and they will be closing the doors forever at this location today at 8:00 PM. This was a very nice place to hang out and a big part of that was the staff. The food was very good as well and was just an overall fun place to be. The one in Orange or the one in Costa Mesa just isn't the same. This place will be missed by me and all of us that regularly came here for many many years. Best of luck to everyone here!

TGI Friday's is a chain so if you've been to one, you've essentially been to them all (unless there's magical mystical Friday's I've never heard of). This location isn't too busy...although it gets incredibly LOUD in there. They have good lunch time deals, like the endless soup and salad, where you really get some good bang for your buck. Otherwise, there's nothing spectacular. Good service, no complaints. Our server in particular went out of her way to help us save a few dollars with how we ordered...I really appreciated that. There's just so many other eateries in Orange County that I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here.

Food was terrible- I am 100% confident that they use GMO chicken. Makes you feel so terrible after and agitated.all these restaurants using gmo foods are very well aware of what they do to the consumer. these GMOs are killing people with their cancer infested food and they are okay with this to make a buck! One day the restaurants like this along with many, will soon pay for it all. Very soon!!! The owner of this place should be ashamed to serve garbage meats and chickens to the person who is feeding them to keep the place open.one day and soon- all these restaurants serving cheap and terrible and not to mention compromised foods will not see an end to all of this! Shop non GMO everyone and let's prove a point so these places close down vs kill us with cancer.

I want this place to close.  I've lived nearby for 20 years and they still have a horrible menu and stinks of old mop. If you are desperate for a bad glass of wine get ready to be served in the equivalent of a ball jar.  The rim is so thick it makes their bad wine even worse. Sadly,  if you'd like a "late" night drink it's your only option in Laguna Niguel.  We are long over due for a quality establishment. Boycott this dive!

1. We asked for a booth, then the lady gave it to another couple ignoring our request. 2. They made a big deal about sitting at the bar for happy hour which never happened before.  3. We saw on THEIR site some margarita specials & the guy didn't honor it 4. It was our happy hour spot but I left without even ordering after so many negative things happening.. I don't think I'll go back as often  I'm giving it 2.5 stars bc of past times.. The mozzarella sticks are really good, & the ghost pepper wings

This review is based on our last visit at 3:00 (Happy Hour) on Friday, April 8.  We ordered Bud Light draft and was served flat beer. We told our server. Then we ordered Coors Light draft and there was black stuff floating around in our drinks. It might have been mold. Our server didn't seem to know. Bottled beer was our next choice.  We wanted to order the new beef tostadas on the all you can eat appetizer menu but they were out of it. Keep in mind that we were there at 3:00. What we did order was good but it was slow to be served.  We tried to watch a basketball game but they did not get that channel.  If we weren't hungry, we would have left. Not sure we will be back after this experience. I'm still not sure after asking if there was mold in our beer why a manager didn't come by to explain what it was.  We have had good times in the past there, but after yesterday we might not have any more Friday's.

I go to watch the football games at the bar area. I have had service so bad. Plus prices are too high and if you order a regular sized entree, it's usually too big and you have it home. Fine, but most of their food reheats poorly. Knowing this I have asked to order a kids meal. Their policy is inconsistent. Some bartenders will let you do it; out and out refuse.  Very likely not to return to this location primarily bc the service is atrocious.

This restaurant's 3 star rating is on point. The food and drinks are very good, otherwise it'd probably get 2 stars, so compliments to the cooks.  The service however, wasn't so great.  We walked in and the hostess was MIA, when we were starting to second guess ourselves and wonder if we should grab menus and seat ourselves another employee greeted us and found the hostess for us. It's Friday night and the hostess isn't prompt at the door? No good. Then we had a friendly young waiter begin our service and take our orders and bring us drinks. 15 minutes later we hadn't seen our server or our appetizer. A friendly waitress approached us and let us know our food would be right out and she'd be taking over our table. We let her know we had ordered an appetizer and she checked and it had never been put in. So eventually we get our appetizer, potato skins, which of course were delicious. Later on our waitress noticed my boyfriend was low on his iced tea and asked, "More tea?" He said yes. He takes a large drink of it and I look at his face. It was a sweetened, raspberry iced tea - he's diabetic.  As a restaurant manager I'm not sure why someone wouldn't clarify if they were confused on the drink before they served it. They comped our potato skins but that's it. Not sure there was a manager on site or not but I would've expected at least the iced tea also be taken off, if not just 20% taken off the whole bill. I like TGI Fridays and will definitely go again, but not to this location. Could've just been an off night, but our experience here was definitely not so good.

Tonight my 1 year old daughter and I enjoyed a mommy daughter date night at Friday's (she loves the Mac n cheese)... Our server, I believe she was in training because she had a shadow...was so sweet to my daughter and I. Our food came out in a timely manner and it was delicious. My daughter ate all of her macaroni and enjoyed being entertained by all of the other servers that stopped by to say hi. A few even gave her a little chocolate kiss.  Not every experience has been perfect, but there are a few star employees here. Being a general manager at a restaurant myself, I give credit where credit is due... And tonight we had a lovely time.

location: South Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA
review: Everything I said prior to this I now take back. Tonight was awful and I will not be back: 1) 15 minutes before we were seen 2) incorrect items brought to us and billed to us 3) no place settings until we asked for them 4) no empty cups taken - our table was a cup graveyard 5) we asked our server for suggestions and he had no idea - directed us towards something off-menu 6) I have never given a 0.00 tip until tonight. 7) don't go here. 8) cheap because low quality.

More of 2 and 1/2 star here. First off, I really hated their lousy complicated menu book that looks like a rag or something. Items are scattered all over and too many highlighted combo deals or whatever that are just so confusing.  For $10 appetizer deal, you need to stick with only one item till you get sick of it. For the half off deal during happy hour, anything with seafood in it is excluded. For 3 appetizer combo, you can't sub.  I came here for a good deal more than a quality of course other wise why would I ever dine in at TGIF...?! But the whole deal thing isn't worth at all. I got spinach dip flat bread which was undercooked, bread was like un-toasted pop tarts. Barely tasted spinach dip. Chicken strips was the best of what I had. It is Crispy kung pao chicken style pop corn chicken kinda dish. Buffalo wings were whatever. At least wings are not fatty, but thin and crispy, but there's no mini drumsticks at all. Long island tea cocktail for $5 was more like a citrusy ice tea with a hint of alcohol. ;)  My waiter was attentive and restroom was clean.

This is my second time at this location, the first time was great this time i can't say the same. Our server (mike) was very slow and not attentive at all. Our beers were flat. We drank our first glass of beer before our food got there, yea it took a looooooong time for us to get our food. When my boyfriend asked for his second beer we watched as mike and the bartender noticed something on the glass (grossss!) And what did the bartender do? Just switch the beer to a different glass. I gotta say we lost our appetite after we saw that. We got the endless appetizers, we knew we were going to have a second serving so we told our server to start on the next plate. We finished our first plate and we had to wait at least 10 min after for our second plate. Ridiculous...  I wish I could give 0 stars but I have to give at least one so there you can have one. We will NOT return to this location again.

Summary: Food: 3/5 Service: 4/5 Atmosphere: 5/5 The tone for this review was solidified when the food came out and the person asked "are you ready for your sizzle?" followed by pouring sizzling sauce on my skillet. The sad little sizzle fizzled after a mere few seconds, setting the ambiance for the uninspiring meal that followed.  I ordered the Sizzling Chicken and Spinach. The meal is fairly small portion with a default Caprese salad side. This dish should be renamed to "Sad Sizzling Chicken and Uncooked Mushrooms" because the mushrooms were not cooked. The amount of spinach you get makes me question how this ingredient made it into the name of the dish. I DO NOT recommend this dish.  Wife got the Skillet Shrimp on top of risotto-style rice. Again, the portions were small for the price you pay here, but compared to the chicken dish - this one actually tasted good. Not to mention she got a lot more sizzle and less fizzle. The overall ambiance of this location is pretty nice. Plenty of parking and decent views.  Note: Waitress specified that it's happy hour all day (this was a Sunday) which means 1/2 off appetizers except the Jack Daniels dishes.  Other thoughts: Restroom was filthy. Window sills very dirty. Management, I think you can really improve patron experience by keeping things clean.  Overall: Good location, relaxing and nothing too terrible to complain about. So-so food not worth the price imo.

Haven't been here in a long time but we wanted some drinks somewhere close to the house. Mikey-the bartender is-AMAZING! Strong drinks & he is so personable & fun! Definitely will be back soon for some cactus coolers & white gummy bears!

Out driving around looking for a place to eat, decided to stop in to TGI Friday's. I don't eat here very often at all, I think about three or four times in the last 10 years. But I think I know why I don't eat here very often.  The food is just generic and bland. For the cost, you would expect a lot better. I first ordered the potato skins with cheese and bacon, it tasted like they were fried in very old oil. Then for the entrée order a turkey burger and french fries.  I'm sorry to report that the turkey burger was disgusting. I didn't even finish half of it. The French fries were fried in the same oil as the potato skins. Yuck. I well I'm leaving the restaurant now, I must go purge. :x I feel sick.

Once every three or four years I make a mistake and drop in to eat here. Our lunch took 45 minutes despite the fact the restaurant is empty, and the chicken on my pecan crusted chicken salad wasn't thoroughly heated in their microwave - sad they couldn't cook it fresh, or at least get it hot!  Hopefully despite it's location near a great movie theater, I will remember to not eat here!

Always a good time at TGI Friday's.  Been going here for decades and their food is always great.  So many choices!  Late night specials, happy hours and lots of good games.  It was so great watching Kobe Bryant's final Laker game at TGI Fridays while enjoying dinner.  Their french onion soup is the best.

Momma always said, "If you can't say something nice, then don't say anything at all."  If mom was right then Yelp would only have 4 and 5 star reviews.   I have discovered that there are generally only two types of restaurants which inspire an immediate review.  One of these is that wonderful experience you want to share because you really want the proprietor to succeed.  THIS IS NOT THAT REVIEW! This is the kind of review that is a lot like that 10 MPH sign ahead of a sharp curve.  Just don't do it without caution.  Is some of it personal preference?  Sure, all reviews are.  Is some of it meant to wake up the owner and management?  Well, yes...but let's be honest here, TGI Friday's is a big chain that has taken years to suck this hard and must have had to endure and neglect many other genuine attempts by well-meaning critics.  You can't sink to this level of brass-handled, 1980's motif where grandma's cabin's faux Tiffany lamps are stuffed into an aged split level dining cube staffed by well-meaning teenagers, without possessing a certain disdain for your clientele.  Add in the three loud drunks at the bar watching the ball game and you begin to get an accurate picture the place. Where shall I begin?  I arrived on a Sunday at what one could rationally consider "brunch hour" only to be admonished with "we don't serve breakfast here" coupled with a side of indifference.  Quickly adjusting to lunch back-up mode I politely ask if there is some way I could possibly rather get a 1/2 sandwich/soup combo.  "NO!  We don't do that either".  "Well alrighty then.  how about a soup/salad combo since I see you have both soup and salads on the menu?", I asked.  "No, we don't do those combos except of Mondays and Fridays", was the rapid reply.  Confused, I simply ordered a chicken caesar salad from the coffee table sized book titled "Menu". It should be noted that the menu resembles one of those fancy cards at the Hallmark store which has the pop-outs in it along with all the neat things to look at.  This is just the type of thing which should remind you of the dining maxim: "Never trust a restaurant that tries to do everything.  You will find that they do nothing well." Why did I come here?  Why, oh why when I had resolved almost two decades ago after  a few crappy experiences that this place and I should never be alone together in a dark alley?  Perhaps it is because I recently moved into the neighborhood and in a moment of Sunday morning hunger-weakness I succumbed.  Yes, against my better judgment I decided to give Fridays another chance.  Has that type of thinking EVER worked out? The food?  Generic crap on every level!  A soupy thrown-together chicken Caesar drowning in mock Caesar dressing.  When I asked for fresh cracked pepper my waitress left for a few minutes and then returned to the table with a standard pepper shaker from another nearby table.  I let it go realizing that this was just not meant to be.  I left my $15 on the table for my paltry salad and water and tucked my tail silently between my legs and headed out the door from the 1980's time travel back experience and returned to the world of late 2015.  There was sunshine and cool air and I could breathe once again.  As I walked out I noticed a sign on the wall asking if everything was ok and if not to take a survey that was attached to the bottom of the bill.  I returned to the table to get that survey only to find the receipt had no such place available.  Defeat and disappointment were once again the strongest flavors served up at this aged eatery. If you think about it for more than a second, It does beg a question, doesn't it?  If you post a sign asking for disappointed clients to speak to the management or leave their concerns, isn't this a tacit admission that you know you're disappointing your customers and that you actually ACCEPT it?   Move over Denny's, there's an old kid in town and you're gonna have to fight pretty hard to keep the suck-fest crown. Friday's, are you listening?  Do you even care?  Let's say it together..."NOPE!"  Here's to wishing you a quick and speedy bankruptcy.  Please go away and make room for a real dining establishment, one which actually cares, PLEASE!

Completely disappointed.... drinks were good and the waiter Jordan was a nice kid. The plating in the Jack Daniels sampler plate was a joke. The ribs were cooked too much so they were dry. The popcorn chicken was burned. And the cajun shrimp was hardly cajun...The breading was soggy and flavorless.  And the Potatoe skins tasted like they were drop last week. Don't even try the desert! All around terrible food from terrible cooks. Don't eat there

I've been coming here with friends and family for years and love the jack Daniels specials and the great happy hour. Best place to come for tasty apps and cheap drinks, plus they're open late, so in this neck of the woods that's always nice!
Michael is an amazing bartender!  I normally avoid national restaurant chains but TGIs in Laguna Miguel is the exception when Michael is working.

Doing this review right after our meal.  This was the worst experience we waited for half an hour after we placed our order before our food arrived and our burgers were super dry and lacked any flavor, and our waitress never came by and refilled our drinks during our whole visit.   And this was right around 1130 when we got here and there was only 2 other people in the whole place.  We are now leaving at 1216.  The waitress are to worried about firetrucks outside dealing with someone that is not a customer versus the people inside that are actual customers.

If I could possibly give this place a zero star rating I would! The service was so awful it took the server twenty five minutes just to take are drink order. I highly recommend everyone to not go here! The food is very expensive and such shity quality for the prices! This place is at the top of my list for worst restraunts around!

Thank god it's not Friday's ! I used to think Friday's was an average ( 3 star eaterery  not worthy of a yelp ) but my last experience left a bitter taste in my mouth ! To start things off it was very warm in the restaurant which had us and the waitress sweating ( she was literally sweating on the floor ) . I ordered a margarita and it came out waterdown and already separating not to mention it tasted and looked like it was all artificial so I sent it back. Ordered around of their famous potato skins ........ But these weren't the skins I used to know. The skins were very greasy and they used a cheese similar to cheese whiz ...... Like come on ! So I ended up sending that also back. Wings were just OK ...... Friday's more like a Monday morning

Fix your broken wheelchair lift or put in a disabled access ramp for those who can't walk up stairs or use a walker or wheelchair. It's the law! I've been working with this establishment for well over a year on this issue and am done being nice and accepting their complementary meals. That doesn't fix the issue at hand. Finally just filed a complaint with the US Department of Justice. Americans with Disabilities Act is the law and this TGIF is out of compliance therefore breaking the law. It's time for a remodel or close your doors. On a positive not the general manager Kurt is very nice and as accommodating as possible. This issue is out of his hands. I understand that it's a fa chose but the powers that be need to get it together. It's 2016!!!

I will show some love and give one star   Sat down was not even greeted I had to ask a server to ask a server to get our server.   I was very thirsty and was craving lemon water and I asked if she didn't mind putting a extra wedge of lemon in my water she forgot and apologized I was ok with that of course but when she never brought it back after reminding me that she'd be right back with it 2 more times.  I brushed it off.  I ordered tomato bisque soup and salad.   (Brought out together) (not my servers fault) but my soup tasted like marinara sauce my server did notice I didn't eat more then a spoon of it she was nice enough to take it off the tab.  The problem with TGIFRIDAYS is the food maybe executives need to reevaluate their menu.   It's been a long time coming
Common TGIF!  You're getting old and rundown.   Even feels dirty, dingy, dark.  Food is out of date too... Unhealthy

This was a horrible dinner! When I first got there it wasnt busy at all, so I got seated right away. I had a party of 7 and my husband and I ordered the apps promo, it was honestly horrible! And in no sence as they described it, it took forever to get my apps when I wanted a new one, and my daughter ordered a cheese pizza, and apperently they thought she ordered a cheese burger so that brought that out on accident, and they said, "opps we brought the wrong thing". I complained to mangement, and they did nothing, all they said was, "We will pass your info on.."

This place is a JOKE. We went in on Friday night for dinner and drinks around 7pm. The place was not busy at all and there was plenty of staff on, all hanging out in the back upper corner sitting at a table. The bar was filthy! We sat with empty beers for over 10 minuets as well as the guests next to us before we had to flag down a server to go get our bartender from the group of employees sitting at a table hanging out. There is clearly no manager on duty. We left before our food or drinks ever came. Very disappointing. This location needs a new staff and new management. Don't waste your time or money.

Decided to come here on a Wednesday night with a bunch of my friends, we were seated promptly however it took approximately 15 minutes for a waitress to come take our drink order, only because we flagged one down. After we ordered our food, it took about an hour to get our food. I do not recommend this TGI Fridays to anyone who is looking for a well rounded restaurant.

The thing about TGI Friday's and its constant cycle of reinvention is... it WORKS! Other businesses take note: Friday's taps into its customer base and turns out a quality product. I still remember my first time into a Friday's as a little kid, and I still remember my last Friday's happy hour most recently. Both come up in the annals of my mind as being great experiences. Having a consistent happy hour really speaks volumes. Half off appetizers that come out to be around $4-6... drink specials that reflect current trends... a good solid abundance of cheap beer... and now they even have high quality-low price sliders and fries. Genius! Our server at this location, Kiki, was VERY cool. Poor thing was stretched to her physical limits by the end of our visit, but she (and everyone else, from host/hostess to server to bartender to busboy and everyone else in between) was very warm and welcoming. The FK and I had only two items of note: one, the bar tables are VERY high in comparison to the barrier separating the bar area from the dining area. Thus, we were in constant fear of dropping a ketchup bottle or something on some kid playing with her balloon animal. And two, like I mentioned before, business picked up toward the end, which meant an impossibly long wait for our check. But otherwise, I absolutely love Friday's and I always will!

I have lived nearby for years service is horrible the blonde manager I will not mention names should not be working there she treated us like 2nd class citizens we wish this this place to close or reopen under new management with all new employees. Save your money and spend it else where food not good and service is poor

Service is horrible I take back the good things I said about this place. The last 4 times we've been here have been absolute disappointment. The bartenders they now have are a joke and have no sense of customer service or better yet any education at all. I personally do not like or want to hear how poorly these employees talk to each other. I think someone from management should really make a change on the poor service that is provided at this place. I have now vetoed this place and will no longer give any of my hard earned money to this place. I am ashamed that I personally bragged about this place to my friends and family. Hasta nunca TGIF

My wife and I have been customers since the early 70's at TGI Fridays.  In my business and personal life surely I have spent more than $20K in their stores.  But that has come to an end.  The store in Laguna Niguel has been going down the tubes for many years, as evindenced by hardly any customers on two Saturday Nights.   The final insult to us has been visiting this location two out of the last three weekends. Upon entering the restaurant in Laguna Niguel on Saturday evenings both times we encountered the same hostess.  The first time it was extremely cold outside and walking into the store it was also cold.  She immediately takes us over to the area just to the left of the front door by the windows.  I said "we would rather not sit here, it's too cold, could you put us up past the bar, where it is warmer".  She proceeds to tell me that because of staffing we would have to be sitted in this area.   We were mortified.  She parks us next to a large and loud party group that was out of control.  Who would park a 60 year old couple next to a loud obnoxious group, when they specifically asked to sit somewhere else.   This past Saturday we entered the restaurant to be greeted by the same hostess.  She tried to seat us in the same place again and I complained and insisted on another spot.  She now takes us to the right in basically the same area but the opposite side as before.  The only person in that area was a guy with a bucket cleaning the floors next to where we were seated.  We were horrified and left.  I came back in to talk to the Manager, she finally came out from the back after waiting at least ten minutes and me asking two different people to get her.  She barely said anything, did say "sorry" but was completely disinterested in what I had to say.  She basically just blew me off.  Shame on TGI.. what a pitiful disgrace to your former self... I can't wait until this location changes hands. Hope it is TGINF.  Thank Goodness it's Not Fridays!!! Good-bye!!!!!!

The experience was sub par to begin with, but did not improve over the course of the meal. We don't usually go to chains, but we had never been to this restaurant and thought we would give it a chance. The host was polite and welcoming. However, while we were waiting for someone to greet us and take drink orders at our table he, two other employees were talking loudly with each other about the table that had just left and were commenting on the lady being fat and stated she had a "FUPA" which I found to be very offensive. I ignored the comment and proceeded to choose a salad and appetizer from a menu they had on the back page with special pricing. The server was in training and we were very understanding of his timing and nerves. However, his trainer, Lacy, was not really training him very well. My husband and I are both in hospitality management and felt bad for the guy in training. The food was not very good, but edible. We laughed that we would check that chain off the list now. No bid deal. Our check arrived and was incorrect. We were overcharged for the salads. No one could find the manager. The server came out and stated it was policy that he could not correct the charge, but couldn't explain it. We were confused as to why the GM sent a server in training out to explain something that he did not understand himself. Then, Lacey came running out after we explained how discourteous it was that the manager didn't feel it was important to explain our bill and the "policy" that no one could explain. Poor management. Let down experience.

Me and my beautiful had tgif. We had happy hour. Food was awesome like always.  I had chicken Nacho Grande. Was good but ckn was a bit dry. I let our server know. David was good to get me something else. So i got the oreo madness. Omg bomb! Very sweet.  So he took off nacho and oreo.  Was not looking for all that. But tgif knows how to make their guests happy. Thank you and God Bless.

Happy hour all day on Sundays is Great! Especially it's football season! I like the endless special! If you come with 2-4 people you can have a real party and have food enough for all! Wine is good! I had the endless boneless wings, the blue cheese sauce was luke warm, just ok! The wings were nugget-like, buffalo sauce was just ok, and garlic Parmesan was ok too!  Not too crowded not sure why, perhaps people do NOT know happy hour is all day on Sundays, just like I didn't! Also saw someone picking up catering food for a home party! Good idea! Food is good!

My friend and I wanted to hang out and when we hang out we usually get some grub.  I had a hard time deciding on a place, but with much deliberation and tummies grumbling we chose this place since we hadn't been here in years.   The first thing I remembered when stepping in was at how loud it is.   The next thing was when we looked at our menus how EXPENSIVE it became.  This to me was a SUPER SHOCKER because I just don't think of Friday's food being that much of a WOW factor.   That being said, my friend and I weren't terribly hungry so we split an Apple Harvest Chicken Salad with the dressing on the side. (FYI - NO CHARGE for splitting items)  Now, I'm not a big fan of dressing so I asked for Olive Oil and Balsamic because I like my salads with a tiny bit of flavor.  (They DID NOT have Extra Virgin Olive Oil) and only had a Canola Olive Oil Blend.   OK, maybe I'm ignorant, but I don't know of any other restaurant that doesn't have pure Olive Oil and was quite disappointed by it.  So, I opted for squeezing the rest of my lemon from my water on my salad.   The salad was only OK - NO WOW factor and it was just meh.  The portion size to the price of the salad was not equal and nothing to write home about.  (In my mind I was thinking - I've actually been to fast food restaurants where the salad is bigger, better tasting and a much better price).     At least our waitress was super nice and attentive throughout our whole dining experience. Hence, the three stars. We were debating on dessert, but the devils on our shoulders told us to go for it.  We orderd the Brownie Sensation and I have to say it was the STAR of the show.  Rich, decadent and down right satisfying.   Would I come back here?  UHM - NO, probably not.  I feel like there are WAY better restaurants where you can get a bigger bang for your buck.   If you want a drink and to socialize it's one thing, but if you want good instead of meh food I'd think twice before you come here.

Good old comfort American food. Fried, battered, and loaded with that. This is just like all the other locations, the staff is pretty solid though, and bar staff is friendly. Happy hour goes a good portion of the day, it's a fun place to go to with friends for appetizers and drinks in the bar.

I know, you're thinking, "Who ever gives TGIF 5 stars?!" I went to this TGIF last month for dinner to use a 25% off coupon; I got a salmon platter that was so excellent, I just have to brag about it. The salmon was baked to perfection with a delicious sauce poured lightly over and around it; the spinach was cooked perfectly as well ... obviously they used fresh spinach and sauteed it very lightly. Even the usual potatoes with the meal were great. This was, bar none, the best meal I have ever had at any TGIF I have ever visited. The waiter was good, and although it was a bit slow to get the meal, after I received it and realized how wonderfully cooked everything was, well ... I can give them a break for making me wait for more than 15 mins. It was well worth it. I will definitely be going back to this TGIF in the near future!

Our family came in for lunch hoping to catch the football game. It's a typical Friday's and they have Directv Sunday Ticket. But if you come in between games don't ask the service to change the channel to a live game. They must have a policy to not change channels and they seem confused. We were patient and eventually we were able to watch some games that were already on. It's great to have a kid-friendly place to watch some football. Friday's menu does not have too much on the healthy side but they do have veggie and turkey burgers and they publish the calorie count per dish. We will come back.

Went for HH! Drinks were good (Long Island iced tea)... Service terrible....slooooooooow...... Super disappointing nachos - virtually NO CHEESE so had it not been HH, and if they had been full price, I'd have really been bummed.  When we let the server know that we were disappointed, he said if we wanted to pay $.59 we could order them again and for $.59 have extra cheese, I don't know why we should have to pay for extra cheese when they should've just come with some cheese, but we went ahead and agreed to do it just to see, and then they came out and the cheese was there, but it was NOT  melted it was still in a grated fashion spread along the chips... It also turned out to be $.99  when we got the check, I mean not that that's a huge amount of money but it's the whole point that we should not even have to pay for something that we should've gotten originally, these are originally $10 nachos and it's a plate with very few chips and some tasty toppings but come on they should have at least put a little cheese on them!  Also they come with a little bit of sour cream and guacamole, and let me tell you those scoops of that were so minuscule it was like a teaspoon size, ridiculous So not smiling when I say "cheese"!:( We ordered chicken strips with bourbon sauce, that was tasty, but it was mostly little chunks of breading with very little chicken inside-actually kind of a joke... They were not chicken strips, more like little tiny nuggets of breading with this tasty sauce.... And I would say pass on the potato skins, they're basically deep fried chunks of potato with a little cheese melted on top that have no flavor at all... The place was pretty much empty except for people sitting in the bar area which is where happy hour goes on. They won't let you sit in a more comfortable area just outside of the bar and have the same happy hour prices, even though the place is virtually empty, and I will never understand why corporate America does not understand that by skimping on portions and doing things like not giving any cheese on nachos that they're not going to increase their business, that's WHY the place is NEARLY empty... Places that aren't doing well that decide to give you less and less and less eventually  go under, and I hate to see it because it would be sad, but I think TGI Fridays days maybe numbered unless they turn this around:( Have you ever noticed it's the mom-and-pop places that really give you great portions that have lines out the door? Even some franchise and corporate places do a great job... Like Panini Cafe in Aliso- it's great- but it's not a HH kind of place.... There are many places that have HH though, so I guess I'll keep looking! I really hope this place can pull it together and improve, but I'm afraid that corporate decisions keep them from making really great good portioned dishes and it's killing their business.  It's really gone downhill for years, I used to go and get a very good pasta that came with this incredible garlic bread on the side, and then one day they just quit bringing the bread and said that it no longer came with bread!!!!! Things like that are going to put them under, if they don't go in the opposite direction!!!! I don't get it when people with biz degrees making corporate decisions don't get it and cannot see the problem and make reverse decisions!  My degrees are not in business, but I know people, I know how to sell, I know about selling units and pricing and have to say- the folks making decisions at TGI Fridays are blowing it big time!!! Too bad... :(

Terrible.  I have NO idea how this place is still in business.  The food is terrible, takes FOREVER to come out after you order.  The waitress we had smelled horribly like BO & constantly reached across in front of us.  It was painful to get through the meal.  We will never go to TGIFridays again.  Sad because it used to be good - WAY back in the day.

We often go here, this is very nice restaurant with most friendly staff. The manager Merrily is wonderful, she will treat you professionally if you have any concern. Our always table is upstairs on corner and Grant is out host most of time. He is a nice and energetic guy and I am sure he will give you a wonderful night to spend there.

As a Regular some of us came to say goodbye on their last night of business. What a waste of time and they were all so RUDE! We are generous tippers as they know but that night, closing or not, they were out of every drink we asked for. Felix and the gal with the short buzz cut sort of hair, literally ignored our order attempts, many times. Felix acted like he was doing us a favor to serve us let alone acknowledge us. Felix is transferring over to the Costa Mesa location, and Fridays should be notified how rude he can be. I betcha he won't last there anyway, being the clientele will not tolerate his lackadaisical attitude, etc. We ended up only having one drink, and then headed off to Patsy's down the street. They greeted us nicely, and we had a great rest of the night. SOoooo Long Fridays staff, you ended on sour note, literally!

Their happy hour is the best around. All day on Sunday and twice a day, every day. Service was very friendly and attentive. All of their appetizers are delicious especially the nachos and spinach dip.

Went here and got a huge dose of nostalgia. I have a lot of TGIF memories. Not in this particular one, but there is some comfort in the fact that they will all look the same no matter where you are.  The happy hour specials were great. Half off on appetizers, $3 beers and $5 margaritas. The potato skins were a little sad, but I wasn't really there for the food. The margarita was still pretty good though -- just what the doctor ordered for a brief respite from a family-packed weekend.
Would have given zero stars if I could.  We sat for 10 minutes without any acknowledgement.  Left without ordering.  Told them we were leaving because we were ignored... They didn't seem to care!

Surprisingly nice for a sports bar. Good food, especially the Chipotle Yucatan Salad. Drinks rock and the atmosphere is really nice.  Kid friendly, date friendly and awesome place to watch games or spend a quiet New Years Eve out.
Horrible management, food and service. One manager overheard constantly discussing her surgery and berating customers and staff. In a word, the worst restaurant in OC.

What a disaster this place was! horrible food! Horrible service! Blonde girl with zits on her face was a complete bitch. Food was cold /had hairs in it, no utensils, had to eat with my fingers first 10 minutes.

I love Fridays but do not go to this one!!!! The food is horrible. I ordered potato skins and they were not potatoes! They were extremely over-cooked. Then I asked to switch to wings and when they brought the wings to the table I took the first bite and felt like I was eating grease. They were extremely overcooked as well, with very little meat. To top things off the bathroom was awful, there was no toilet paper, soap, or paper towels. My overall experience was awful and I will definitely not be returning until they clean up their act. I would've rated them 0 stars but it wouldn't let me!

A) This place is a dump - the 50s want their decor back! B) The table was dirty. C) BEWARE - they do not honor advertised specials!!! D) They defraud their customers - me and my partner explicitly ordered the "All day every day" beer special from the ad on the phone; the waitress read the beer name from the phone; I specifically asked about price of large vs. small beer and ordered the "$3 special". That's a binding contract. At bill time, the prices were different. E) The manager was like "by CA law I cannot change the price". BS + the price is wrong to begin with!  Either very poorly-trained or purposefully preying on OC show-offs with no backbone - "honey, don't cause a scene for $2 on at $33 tab"... F) The portions were small and the food was bland, but that's true of every TGI Fridays... To recap - over $2 on $33 bill - the waitress lost a $7 tip, I will likely be disputing the charge with my credit card and filing complaints with BBB and CA AG, and of course, due to all of the above never going there again! Was TGIF's illegal and bad-business behavior worth it?

Very disappointing, the food did not have taste and the server had no enthusiasm. She was not attentive did not clear plates could not address any issue. A ticket for 4 over $100 not even a 1 star. Obvious management does not care about the customer not even present in the restaurant. The WSJ article is correct the chain had lost  interest in the consumer.

3 $ prices, 2 $ food. The service is friendly & professional & we didn't wait long for service or our order to arrive. The table was wobbly & we spilled our coffee the first time one of leaned on the table. After that I just kept my weight on it to avoid it tipping from side to side. The spinach dip use to be absolutely heavenly but this time it was just good...but the chips were slightly stale.  Buffalo chicken burger - a little tough Crab cakes - ok. The sauce was spicier than I was expecting.

TGI Friday's is a great restaraunt but lacks things.I got the kids burger and it was too small. My sister got the kids Mac n cheese and said it was too rich.The waitress messed up my dads order by putting tomato on his salad when he asked for no tomato on his salad.Overall, no good service. And the decor was cheesy. It was not good service.

I had to go find a waiter after sitting for 20 minutes after finishing my food. More than once. Ordered the appetizer special, which wasn't explained to me. Expressed to the manager I would just like to change my order to something that fit what I was actually looking for and pay the difference for it. I was told no, and if I wanted more appetizers then pay double for it. Poor service.

Go here enough that they bring me my food and drinks without having to order them when I walk in. Recent management change makes service difficult- Today topped it off. 20 minutes from walk in we got menus and able to order a drink and appetizer. Waitress tries to take away our menus at this point and I had to ask her for them back. Order food later and waitress comes back 'I forgot it is Sunday you cannot order the Blt for lunch like I said you can'. Food comes 40 minutes later and I complain to waitress about the service. She rolls her eyes at me as she walks away and starts talking about it to other employees like I am not there.  Simply said it is my money and I exchange it for service. This location will not be seeing any more of mine.

So we came here after a night of shooting down at On Target.  For a late night this place was kind of perfect.  With the freezing cold out it was not overly crowded and they were open late.  My BF and I started with the pretzels.  OMG at first I wast like "WTF Mate?"  pretzels really?  but they were sooo good.  soft and squishy on the inside with just enough crunch on the outside.  I personally always pick off the salt but thats just me.  the cheese sauce was eh.  but the dough was sooo good.  We then did the 20 for 2 deal.  (I must say im sad that it does not include dessert like at most places) but I had the petite filet with veggies and Parmesan fries.  The fries were NOT worth eating.  Overcooked and hard.  Looked nothing like the pictures :(  no parsley for garnish or anything.  The veggies were good though not over cooked and with just enough crunch left to be appetizing.  The steak was eh.  Slightly over cooked for my med rare and with wayyy too much seasoning.  Texture was more rubbery than anything but thats not the chefs fault just poor quality.   The BF had the bruschetta chicken pasta.  That was actually really good. Maybe its my no carb diet but just one bite of it made me crave more.  I then had to go all out and have dessert.  I got the peanut butter cake which was sooo rich and super sweet.  But oh so peanut buttery good.   Service was great and super friendly.

Absolutely the worst service I have ever had BAR NONE. Drinks were a little slow then it was all downhill from there. I guess the waitress was peeved I wasn't quite ready to order so it took her forever to come back. The food was slow in coming, no silverware on the table, then it was about an hour until we saw anyone again. Ordered dessert and that took ions. Had to wait AGAIN for the bill. Wanted to pay with my card but finally walked up to the bar to pay BECAUSE EVERYONE ELSE IN MY PARTY HAD ALREADY GONE OUT TO THE CAR. Left a modest tip although I should have left 4 pennies so she would have gotten the message that her service wasn't worth a nickel. Oh by the way the steaks and burgers were FABULOUS. Now if they can increase the staff and train them better I might be back

The service here was absolutely terrible! About 15-20 minutes after ordering food and appetizers, we had to ask for our soup and salad, which was marginal at best once it finally got to our table and to top it off the crackers were stale. When we asked her for pepper for our salad she told us "I might not be able to get that for you since they've already been put away for the night. " When the under seasoned steak came, it tasted like an uneaten steak from earlier that day that they reheated. No A-1 sauce or ketchup was brought out and our server left before giving us napkins and silverware. After we waited for her to return and our food was getting cold we asked to speak to the manager. The manager quickly apologized and walked away giving all four of us the impression that she could have cared less. I was given a buy one get one free appetizer the last time I had come from a different manager who apologized for the bad service stating  another server took our food by mistake. This trip was me hoping I'd form another opinion but they definitely proved me wrong. I highly recommend going anywhere else if you're looking for good food, positive environment, and friendly and timely service.

Never have been disappointed when it come to food or service. Always get great service and the rib eye steak jack Daniels I get is always in amazing condition! Tasty and very filling a little more pricey than others but it's worth it because of the flavor!

Where do I even begin... My boyfriend and I came here for dinner one night after seeing some commercials for TGIF on TV. It looked good, so we decided to check it out. We were seated right away at a table near the door, which I didn't mind, but it gave us the perfect view to watch the host/hostesses stand around and chat. Our server wasn't very nice, and didn't have a sense of urgency at all. She took our drink order and came back when we were ready to order in a timely manner. I ordered steak. Let me tell you, I love steak, so I was super disappointed when my food (finally) came out and the steak was the size of my fist--and I have small hands! It wasn't cooked the way I wanted it, and it didn't really taste that good overall. The mashed potatoes on the side weren't bad, but the mac n' cheese was awful. It was literally just penne pasta with some shredded cheese melted on top under an overpowering amount of breadcrumbs. There was no sauce. It was literally just cheese melted over pasta. Super disappointing. We got dessert also--I forget the exact name but it was some sort of salted caramel cake... and it was SMALL. I really don't know if the server we had just hated her job or if we were particularly annoying in some way, but I don't think she smiled once the entire meal. Overall, the place is dingy, customer service is practically nonexistent, and the food is tiny and doesn't taste good. Honestly, I feel like this place was such a ripoff because we paid a good amount of money for a tiny portion of food. Don't be fooled--this place may be similar to Chili's in price, but their portion sizes are lousy and the food that you do get is never good. Won't be returning ever again.
This location is okay. They have a great staff. It's also one of the sure shot restaurants on Crown Valley & the 5. In my opinion this is the right restaurant in the right place.
Good food and value at happy hour.  Mediocre to terrible service.

Happy Hour is alright....nothing special. $4 Beers and $5 Martinis...ya, that's all I really went for and didn't get as buzzed as I would have liked. I was slightly disapointed when 99.9% of the items on the menu contained meat...no bueno for us vegetarians. The waiter did suggest this sandwhich that he could sub the meat with mushrooms, so I tried it. It was pretty tasty actually, but wouldn't go back for the food considerering I couldn't eat most of it. All in all, decent place, but not my fave Happy Hour location. I'd prefer somewhere else....

Ok this place is good but the service is kinda bad unless you hit the bar.Also if you go for happy hour they will tell you can't share food together.So just watch out for that.had to complain about that part the manager. Love the bartender he is on it and always smiling.

I've seen better bathrooms at dive bars. Had to wipe with a toilet seat cover because the toilet paper was out. Food portions were smaller than depicted on menu. I used to be a huge fan of their 5 cheese mac n cheese. Whatever they have now isn't worth the money.

The food is disgusting and not even heated properly (which prob means it was sitting around and they threw it in the microwave to get it semi-warm).  The drinks were awful, the cleanliness was poor and the service was so-so.  Very overpriced!  I came here twice to give it a second chance, but I will never return.  2 stars for good location.

Tired, indifferently staffed, expensive, poor quality, overall they don't work for your business. When wait staff is this unaccommodating, it usually means a boss no one one wants to work for, and/or corporate micromanagement. I usually don't hang complaints on the ones who serve the public -- they usually just want to make their customers happy and get good tips. This place is consistently downbeat and unpleasant. They water down their soft drinks, they skimp on portions, their windows are unkempt, the restrooms are in very worn down condition. I think they stopped caring years ago, because it has been like this as long as I can remember. Too expensive for these persistent hallmarks of poor management.
Love their steak , service , open late, Specially Mo is doing amazing job , we are coming in only because of her great service

We were excited to come here because it was our first time at TGIF and the pictures on the menu looked so good. Our waitress was very friendly and all the other staff seemed to be nice, too. When the food came out, we were utterly disappointed by the quantity and how different it looked from the pictures!

Terrible service. Unfriendly employees. They Charged me multiple times on my credit card. We waited 20 min for someone to come take our drink order and it was a slow day. This place is absolutely HORRIBLE. I don't know if all locations are like this but stay away from this one.

We went to tho Fridays an it took more than an hour for our food too come it was TERRIBLE service but a nice waitress.Then we get out food and we ordered a median rare stake witch was DISGUSTING  it wasn't even really cooked it was raw and made us feel sick.Then we also ordered the crispy chicken fingers and it was not cooked fully. DONT WASTE YOUR TIME AND MONEY!!! IT IS WORST THAN POOP ON ICE!!!!
I ordered the Jack Daniels chicken strips, good stuff. to my surprise there was karaoke in the back, and on a wednesday. didn't see that comin. were definitely goin back next wednesday

False Advertising Alert --  This place does NOT honor the 2 for $10 deal as advertised on TV and on their website.   I was at the gym and the TGIF commercial came on, saying that they had a 2 for $10 deal (appetizer, entree or dessert - pick 2 for $10).  Pretty good deal, right? Yea, unless they lure you in with this and then refuse to honor it! And I fell for it like a bunch of other suckers in the restaurant.   THAT SAME DAY, I packed up the whole family and headed down to TGIF that same day.  I ask about the deal, and the waitress says, we don't have that anymore.  I PULLED UP THE TGIF WEBSITE ON MY PHONE, WHERE IT SAYS 2 for $10 AND SHOWED HER.  She responded, we're "independently owned" not a "franchise" so we don't have the same deals as they advertise on TV and on the website.  I wanted to pound my fist on the table and shout, "BULLSHIT LADY!!" but instead I suppressed my rage and responded, "hmm, interesting... ok then."  The best part was when another huge group comes in and asks for the 2 for $10 deal, and the waitress tells them the same thing.  Then THEY all pulled out their smartphones and showed her the website!! And they were even more pissed than we were!  I almost felt bad for our server... This place has bad management, but she also should have spoken to the manager about it.  I was so pissed that I got suckered into this, but obviously I didn't want to make a scene or ruin my family's dinner over it.   On top of it all, the food sucked baalllzzz.  The chicken tasted like it had been fried in 2 day old oil, the salad was super tiny for $11.  The pictures in the menu are truly deceiving.   This place is not at all like the TGIF on Anton in Costa Mesa.  That TGIF is much better.  I ordered the exact same salad there, and it was 2x larger, and much more fresh, and the server was much nicer.

Fridays Fridays Fridays.. ive been eating ur food since i was little. I like the fact how your food always satisfy me..  Upon deciding on what to eat on a cold friday night, me and my brother ended up coming here..its almost 10pm when we came so it wasnt that crowded or anything. we were seated pretty fast and our server was a really nice and friendly guy..  as usual, we ordered our favorite jack daniels menu.. my brother got the rib and shrimp w/ jack daniels (JD) sauce with fries and sweet potato fries for $21.99 ( ). and i ordered  JD sirloin steak and shrimp with tomato mozzarella salad and mashed potatoes for $22.99 ( ).  the thing about me and my bro when we go to eat steak is that we always switch our meal.. im a seafood person and my bro is a meat person.. so when our meal came, my bro gave me all of his shrimp and i gave him my steak right away. so i got double portions of shrimp and he got double portions of meat. but i did try a bit of both the rib and the steak. the rib was tender and after i mixed it with  JD sauce, nothing can beat the taste.. im not a big fan of rib, yet i really like the taste of this.. yes, it is that good! the shrimp was obviously my favorite, its crispy, tender, and fresh!! as for the steak, my bro wants it medium well, and so it is..  as for myself, i dont really like to eat meat that still have some blood inside.. just looking at the red color makes me scared of eating it.. so i only ate a piece, the piece with the least blood in it. it was was tender and juicy.. but its not my favorite meal of the day for sure.. their sweet potato fries were also pretty good with a hint of sweetness and saltiness mix together.. tomato salad was descent, and the mash potato was yummy and creamy as a dessert, we ordered salted caramel cake with vanilla ice cream for $5.99 ( ). i like the thin pudding layer on the top of the cake, but the cake itself wasnt that good.. i dont think ill get this again the next time i come here. Our total bills turn out to be $31.. its so cheap, why?! coz i have a buy one get one w/ the purchase of 2 beverages coupon.. but because our server is so nice and friendly, we gage him $9 tip (well above 25%) so our total bill for that night was $40. its still pretty cheap and we had a nice meal. definitely gonna come back, espceially when i have that coupon again! PS. They have happy hour after 10m when you get half price for all appetizer.. i might try that next time

Been coming here for years, maybe too many years.  I come here for the convenience and the consistent food.  However I think it's time to drive an extra few minutes to another local establishment.  Not all, but most of the bartenders are dreadful.  No customer service skills or personality.  Tonight after placing my order I never saw my bartender again.  1 1/2 hours!  The male bartender was fine but both of the girls were awful.  Back in the day the bar experience was not perfect, but a lot better
The best food! Always so tasty and excellent! Love the Jack Daniel's chicken & steak (separate)! Lovely staff. Always room for us. Simple last minute choice for us. Lunch with hubby last week, super!

Absolutely disgusting! We just had a "meal" at this location. Here are the highlights of our experience: -We are seated and our waitress walks by without acknowledging us -After about 10 mins she takes our order -Our drinks come and both cups are filthy with white stuff stuck to the sides and floating in our soda -Our appetizer comes and we notice a long red hair or string inside the sour cream -Our burgers come and they are drenched in grease. So much grease that the paper under them is literally see-through. An overall horrible experience. Never coming back here again!

I went for lunch during the week with my 89-year old mom and my 21-year old son. It wasn't that busy, but our waiter seemed overwhelmed and it was about 20-minutes between visits to our table. Two of us ordered a salad and I found the honey mustard dressing to be tasteless. My son's salad, which was described as having Romaine lettuce, actually had all iceberg (not the green part but the white to yellow part along the rib of the lettuce). Not a very appetizing salad. OK- I know that this is a chain restaurant, but I've been to other TGIF's and never had such marginal and sporadic attention and dull food. Oh- did I mention that my mom ordered the child's portion of the Babyback ribs, which were so charbroiled that even my son had a hard time cutting them apart for her?  The reason I felt compelled to write this review had more to do with the lack of enthusiasm and housekeeping (I felt dirty after leaving the ladies room- trash can overflowing, sink filthy, paper towel dispenser empty, trash on floor). When I initially spoke to our server and mentioned that the TGIF we used to go to had recently closed (R. Santa Margarita), he told me that their location was a franchised store, not a corporate store. I guess that means that there are fewer checks and balances, fewer employees, and the quality of service goes down as a result.
Better than most Fridays.  Food is Meh...  Always get great service from Ryan and Kyle!  Shout out!  Woot Woot!

Being a vegetarian, and craving a veggie burger, I thought I would go to TGI Friday's for one.  WRONG!  The only thing they had to offer me was a turkey burger!  Get with the times, TGI Friday's!  Disgusted.

This place is just ok.  It's kind of what you would expect.  I have been there for happy hour a few times and it's always been fine.  I think that the service is ok, the food is not that great, and the drinks are a little overpriced, even for happy hour.  I think that it's especially difficult for me to enjoy this place because I am a vegetarian and they have almost zero options that don't include meet, which is why we have coined the term: House of Meat 2 for this place.  (Chili's being the original House of Meat).   Nothing to write home about here, but probably will end up coming back at some point in the future just because it's close and convenient and the drinks are pretty good for what they are.  I have some friends that frequent here often because it's one of the only busy bars in the area.

My wife and I attend their happy hour regularly due to their decent selection and delicious appetizers (mind you not all of them are that great but if you know what to order then they have some really delicious stuff). If you prefer to attend happy hour and it is busy, your service is substantially better at the bar than at any of the tables.

Just waited over an hour for our food and it wasn't very good when it came.  Yes, we were a group of 20 BUT we had reservations a week in advance and the place wasn't even 1/3 full.  An hour for TGIFridays?  Really?  Never again.

We have been here several times and each time the service has been horrific! Food is always good but It takes consistently over 10 min to get our drinks and over 30 to receive and appetizer. Like I said this wasnt a one time order 3 time we have been and each time it has been the same. I wont be going here any time soon.

So my husband liked his meal, he got the chicken shrimp Cajun pasta. I on the other hand was very disappointed with my meal,  I got the parmesan crusted chicken,  when they brought it to the table it even LOOKED disappointing but me bring me ate it and said nothing, my husband said I should of because I am paying for it. It looked like something I can make at home and it didn't taste all that great either. I love parmesan crusted chicken and THAT wasn't it. So don't order that or your in for disappointment plus our server was a horrible server, we hardly saw her the whole time we were there so service wasn't all that great either.

Perfect for the price and atmosphere !!! Everyone that works there is amazing and always super friendly!  I have never had a bad experience.  Its the perfect spot to stop in to meet your friends and get some food before you go out or just to stop and have some drinks !!!  Always an awesome experience !!!

The service was good but the food was subpar. The only reason I give 2 stars is for the service. I had the strawberry salad that contained rubber chicken and wilted lettuce. The candied pecans were candy bits you'd find on top of frozen yogurt. I have yet to mask the aftertaste since dinner. If you go here DO NOT order the salad.
Ive never had a worse coors light in my life extremely flat. Service was terrible. Ordered a basket of frys took over 25 minutes to come even though the restraunt wasnt that busy

Came back for happy hour a while back and found this place to be very overrated. The problem is they have way too many customers for the bar its size and if you are thinking about getting something to munch on while you drink, it makes it that much more difficult because service during happy hour is slow! Downgrade to 2 stars.

The food here @ TGI Friday's was okay but if your a stripes member then read what I have to say here: My buddy and I order off the 2 for $20 for dinner since we are both college students trying to save some $$ and I had a $8 stripes reward to take off my bill until tonight it was back in my wallet.  I wasn't aware that franchise store won't honor your $8 off your bill if you order the 2 for $20 but corporate store will gladly take it though.  The server excuse was that the food is already discounted and that this store is a franchise store and corporate store will honor it sorry..... TGI Friday's stripes program totally sucks and there is no where on the Menu that say you can't use your stripes reward on this food!!!

WOW! Can't believe I have not wrote a review on this place in all the years I've been coming here. All I got to say is that Friday's is Friday's. Right? Well almost. We all have our own experiences good, bad or excellent but yet most of us still come back. Why? Well, ask yourself that question. I have not had a bad experience per se but tonight there was a bit of a miscommunication with a couple bartenders, both excellent and worthy of a raise in my opinion, and I was overcharged. Not the biggest deal in the world but it means millions to me to see correct decisions being made in today's competitive restaurant/bar enviornment not to mention lackluster economy.  That decision to erase an controversial overcharge at the bar bumped this review from a 2 star to a 4 star and GUARANTEES the return of me, my wallet (aka the 117 percent tip!!!)  and my friends. More proof that the customer, aka idiot at the bar, is always right. Funny to think I still have my wits about me after over 5 hours of drinking but alas, it's true.

I had a fantastic meal tonight and really enjoyed myself at TGIFridays.  The food was really good, and for a reasonable price, the restaurant was clean and staffed well, but most of all, the service was GREAT!  My family and I go out to eat 2 times a week normally, and I haven't had service this good in a very long time.  I have only went to TGI Fridays at this location a handful of times.  After tonight, I will be going back more often.  I was really pleased and was happy to pay for what I received and even left an extra good tip so Jansen knew how happy I was.  Jansen is a perfect server.  I wish I could take him to every place I want to eat.  Very happy customer:)

I was hungry while shopping at Loemann's and thought I would grab a quick bite at TGIFs .  I had a bad experience at this restaurant several years ago and had not been back until this visit...I gave it a shot because things can change over time.  Sadly, not much has changed. Cigarette smoke wafted from the area near the entrance  door.  Once inside, no one greeted me and I stood waiting for several minutes before someone noticed I was there.  I noticed the manager talking to people at a nearby table, but he didn't make any move to say someone would be with me shortly.  After finally being seated, I began to look at the sticky, tattered menu and waited for 15 minutes before the same person who seated me (not a waitress) came by to take my drink order.  I had to ask her to send my waitress over.  My food came out 15 minutes later.  However, the waitress did not even notice that I had no silverware because I was seated at a table that had not been reset.  The waitress did not come back to see how the food was or ask me if I needed anything.  However, the person that seated me came by and I was able to get silverware and  A-1 sauce.  I picked up the bottle of sauce and realized it was empty and covered with sauce stains...revolting. The food was fine once all the issues were resolved, but I did not enjoy my meal because of my experience.  I should have gone with my gut and driven past. The waitress finally  came by and apologized for the service I received and offered to take something off the bill.  I declined the offer.  She also indicated the manager wanted to speak with me but was on the phone for the moment.  I waited at the table after paying the bill expecting the manager would show up, but he never did.   I hope he reads Yelp reviews because he didn't see fit to come out and address the issues with me in person. Bottom line: Poor service, no enthusiasm by staff for customer service, lack of quality control (tables not reset, condiments empty and or dirty), decent food except vegetables were severely overcooked and mushy. Restaurant deserves 1 star, but gave a courtesy star because most of the food was edible. TGIF- Thank God I'm Finished.  I'm not eating here again.

About once a year my wife, and or kids will talk me into going to this Fridays.  in the 20 plus times I've been to this restaurant since it's opened I've yet to have a good experience with a server.  You get what you get when it comes to the food at any Fridays, I know that, but who hires these servers?  They have no sense of urgency and seem to be put out when asked to do something special, like refill an ice tea!  Forget the gimmicks, I don't care that you can get 42 buttons on a pair of suspenders, just give me a refill on my ice tea!
Since there is not one near my home it was nice tiger to have lunch here. However, Shawn, not real great at his job. He was friendly while he was at our table, but we didn't see very much of him.

This place is just getting worse and worse by the day. Horrible servers and managers. First of all they charged us gratuity because we were using a " large table". I didn't know that my one year old son ordered off your menu. Secondly our waitress,Kelsey was extremely rude.We kept having to ask other servers for refills, napkins etc. When we told the manager we didnt think she deserved the 18% gratuity due to the lack of service, his response was well why should we remove it if you used a large table. When she gave us the bill back she slapped on the table and rudely said HERE YOu Go! And walked off. I think she thought we weren't going to give her anything. We still gave her 15 tip she DIDNT deserve! Thanks for the great birthday Kelsey!!!! Please do not eat there if you want bad service by your waiters AND management.
We always find this TGIF good.  service and food is quick and yummy!  My favorite the Flatiron Steak and moms is either Loaded Potato Skins or the French Onion soup.
This is my favorite place to eat. They have the best BBQ sauce. The best jack Daniels sampler. Great fajitas. Great employees. Always have great experience there. Thank you.

I went with my girlfriend and I have to say that, this one waitress is the reason why  would come back. There was a few ladies that was rude, but this one waitress still was nice to everyone. She didn't allow those ladies to effect her great customer service. Her name is Maylee. I was there last night. I had the best lobster and steak with potatoes and broccoli eveeeer. Thank you Maylee! Ill be back on Tuesdays for you!
Lovely lunch by the window. Great salads and friendly staff. Definitely will be back.

Went to TGI Fridays tonight wit my boo for dinner. Kayla our server was awesome, she gave a recommendation I went with and loved. Food came out fast, drinks were cold and happy hour prices were great! We went about a week prior and both food and service seems to be consistent! All the female servers have it together and are all nice! We'll definitely be back for more Jack Daniels BBQ ^~^

Had the $20 for two people deal (1 appetizer, 2 entrees, and 1 dessert). In my opinion, that's a great deal right there. Upon mid-order I realized the pasta I wanted wasn't on the entree list for the $20 deal. But the waitress totally accommodated me since the entrees were similar. She was super friendly and the food came out hot and delicious. Recommend the Blackened Chicken Alfredo Pasta.  However, I understand other reviewers complaining that the service is slow. Our waitress was great this time, but I have had this same experience, often times when the restaurant was close to empty. And one time, we ordered the hot wings. Don't do that. I'm pretty sure they're frozen to begin with. Other than that, I believe TGIFridays is trying to make a turnaround and you can't beat some of their deals and happy hour prices.

I love this place. I work nights and usually don't to have time for dinner so I come here often. I will sit at the bar though! They have an amazing happy hour and the bartenders are really cool. My favorite things: Spinach artichoke dip and the turkey burger. Mmm freakin delish!
Foods okay , the late night Happy hour used to be better
Had thanksgiving dinner here. Not the first time, it was great watched the game and eat. Our server Amanda was great. Manager was nice too

I travel a lot for work so I have experienced far too many TGI Friday's in my life.  This one was more interesting than normal.  We stopped in for a drink on our way to a cocktail party.  We planned for more traffic and arrived in the area a little early, and no one wants to be the people that show up early or first. The crowd at the bar was rough.  It was 95% creepy men.  The crowd was rough and a little worse for the wear.  I was not expecting this from the area and I was quite surprised. The one upside is that the bar tender poured heavy.  Of course it was mediocore liquor at best, so I guess that may not be a good thing.

color me nostolgic, i cant resist the fridays vibe. Granted we only came in for a quick drink before a movie, but the happy hour was a smkin good deal and the location is always a good thing with a theater next door

Wings had no flavor boneless chicken forgot the chicken plenty of breading and dry like california. Steak done right but no flavor. Forgot salad but brought it out when reminded the waitress. Chips and salsa was chips and spaghetti sauce.

Business 101: If you reject someone from your bar, they take their money and spend it elsewhere. After my friend and I were rejected from Derby Piano Bar at the Kaleidoscope (for a reason I wont digress here, read my next review if you're interested), we decided to enjoy ourselves at TGI Fridays for their late night happy hour =) A couple of their summer special mango drinks and a order of crispy green beans definitely calmed our boiling tempers down to a relaxing mellow mood.  Definitely get the Coo Coo for Mango drink!! ( )  It's a mango mixed drink with cucumber!  My friends all love this drink.  Very delightfully refreshing.  I'm secretly trying to learn to make it myself =P    Also, 50% off appetizers during happy hour; Can't complain about dirt cheap crispy green beans ( ) Definitely come out for the happy hour since it's the only hip late night place to go to in Laguna Niguel that supports the young adult crowd.

I go here because it's very close to my house and it's open late. I signed up for the Stripes card so I always seem to receive some sort of discount. I highly recommend signing up for it if you go often. There are also good deals at happy hour.  I often sit at the bar and most of bartenders/servers there are friendly and polite. Some of my favorite bartenders/servers quit, which is a bummer. When I sit at the bar they are also almost always quick with the refills. They rarely mess up on my orders. It's been a long time since I've had alcohol here, so I can't comment on the quality of the drinks or the prices. My only real complaint is that people sometimes stand near the entrance door and smoke. I wish they would stop that. Oh, and karaoke night on Thursday nights also annoys me.
Service....garbage... Waitress named Bree rude and horrible... Luckily got new waiter named Shaun after numerous complaints and he was awesome... If you are a manager here Bree needs to be fired.

Worst eating experience i have ever had. My wife and I went with a couple that we hadn't seen in years. . We asked to be seated away from the bar to eliminate as much of the crowd noise as possible, and were told "NO". After being seated right next to the bar, we were handed menus and given " PLENTY OF TIME" to decide on dinner choices. As we started to order the waitress informed us that only "ONE" couple could order the "TWO FOR TWENTY" dinner special. TGIF'S, according to her only allows one promotional dinner per table. WHAT A JOKE! So, what they are really saying,is, "WE DON'T EVERYONE TO HAVE WHAT THEY WANT TO EAT, ONLY THE PERSON OR COUPLE THAT WINS THE ARGUMENT ON WHO GETS THE PROMOTION". After being embarrassed and sorry we picked TGIF'S to bring our friends to eat, we conceded to let them have the special and my wife and I ordered choices we really didn't want. When the order of chips and salsa that came with the " TWO FOR TWENTY" dinner, was set on the table, we all looked at each other and began laughing! We counted the chips that were sent to be an appetizer for two people and there were exactly 32 chips on the platter! We flagged down the waitress and quizzed her on the chip dilemma and asked if they refill the chips? Again the answer was "NO"! UNBELIEVABLE! When the meals were delivered to the table, my french fries were cold! I summoned the waitress over and complained about the cold fries. She actually had to ask if i wanted her to bring me some hot fries! i answered "YES", of which never arrived before we were all completed with dinner. I asked to speak to the manager and after a few minutes a "VERY YOUNG GIRL", arrived at the table, and without introducing herself, said "YOU ASKED FOR ME?", not may i help you or anything cordial. I proceeded to explain everything that had happened and why we were so disappointed in TGIF'S policies and this locations terrible service. With a very condescending attitude, she stood there as if i were making all of this up. "SORRY" she said and started to walk away. i called her back and asked her if she even cared about customer service, and her answer was, " MY HANDS ARE TIED AND I CAN'T DO ANYTHING ABOUT POLICY". I said what about the table preference denied? What about the cold fries that never came? What about 32 chips on the platter? Again, the word"SORRY" is all i got. She as much as said to me " IF YOU WEREN'T HAPPY WITH US OR OUR SERVICE, GO SOMEWHERE ELSE FROM NOW ON"! That is exactly what we will do. I will also let anybody and everybody i see and talk to about TGIF'S lack of concern for customer service. I know not everything goes perfect every time you go out to eat, but, it is how the restaurant or the manager handles the problem on what makes a restaurant a place you want to go back too. Her condescending attitude and smirk on her face told me "I DON'T MATTER"! In conclusion, if you don't want to be fraud'ed by dinner deals they won't honor, or want your food hot, or actually get portions that reflect their prices, don't waste your time here.

Happy Hour All Day Sunday! How can you go wrong! Park the car, walk into the restaurant and walk straight past the hostess and into a nice seat at the bar. No waiting, just a few steps in the door and you are sitting at the bar ordering your $5 Ultimate Margarita or Long Island Ice Tea. Appetizers are all 1/2 off (except the platters) The bartenders are always awesome and clearly enjoy their jobs. I would suggest the Spinach and Artichoke Dip, Pot Stickers and an oreo madness to finish it off. Great service. Great food. I honestly wish they would bring back the flair. That is what made Fridays so unique compared to being just like everyone else know. The highest compliment is being made fun of in a movie, they took it as a negative and switched everything. BRING BACK THE FLAIR!

The food was good, but I have had much better service at other TGI's locations.  The bar needs to be cleaned because it was really sticky.  The restroom was also filthy.  The manager is clearly not doing their job.

We came here tonight for my dad's birthday with a larger group. Our server, Jansen was very accommodating and helpful. We had an issue with a meal coming out incorrectly and he went over and above to take care of us. We were very impressed with his service. The food was excellent!! And we had a great time.
