I would recommend this particular TGIF's to anyone!!!
Service was very slow.  Food was sub-par.

Fist word: Nasty  Stopped here last night for a quick meal for a little nostalgia since we used to frequent Friday's years ago. And of course the Sushi Queen wanted some HOT wings. Soggy, minor flavor and the blue cheese dressing they served with it was straight out of a Kraft bottle...Barf.  2nd word: Disgusting  Cobb Salad - Went back. We don't eat frozen lettuce and frozen boiled egg.  3rd word: Meh (I love that word)  Decent flavor burger, mushrooms flavorless and cut so thick they almost over powered the burger flavor. Swiss Cheese was not completely melted. Major burger Faux Pas.  4th word: Get out (sorry two words) We sat at the bar and the hideous smell emanating from, I assume were the mats behind the bar, was so bad we may as well have put a table cloth on dumpster out side. Couldn't even slide the plates on the bar because it was so dirty.  This place if not the Plague will certainly give it to you.  I won't bore you with the service.  But the word that comes to mind is Kindergarten.
We sat at the bar area, which wasn't very busy, and had to wait 10 minutes to order our drinks.
Service was awesome, food was delicious. Everything was great, the ambiance, and area. Nice sunday dinner outting with the fam. Food taste much better than our local area Fridays

I'm usually against writing reviews for chain restaurants, because I figure people generally know what to expect.  But I was compelled to ward off people from this particular TGI Friday's.   The food was horrible.  I've been to this same restaurant before, and I don't remember it tasting this bad.  Everything was overly salty..... and I usually like it salty...but this was overboard.  The chicken was overcooked, and the tomato sauce tasted like it had gone bad.  The only thing that was edible was the Spinach Artichoke Dip.  I was constantly downing water to dilute the overwhelming amount of salt.   The bad experience boils down to the food.  The waiter and hostess were really nice, attentive, and fast.  But when you serve horrible food at a mainstream establishment, you get ONE star from me.

I'm on their e-mail list, and got a coupon for 1 cent appetizers with a purchase of a beverage.  Soda is $2.49. Wow, only 1 penny for a full order of Potato skins? COOL!  This place keeps bringing out the deals.  2 for 1 entree coupons, Reward's loyalty card.. cheap happy hour..   Oh, and the coupons can be used over and over. (they're not coded) The funny thing was when I was in the bar, it was almost full, and everyone had an expensive drink in front of them.    The alcoholic drinks are pricey, but they're good. I had the burger, and it was very average.  My favorites are the Potato skins, french fries or sweet potato fries, and the jack daniels flat iron steak.   The brownie dessert is also good. The ribs are below average. Beware, service can be SLOOOOW in the bar!
I really don't care for TGIF's food, but this particular location has a nice atmosphere and our service was just fine. I enjoyed my cheap beers :)

The only reason this place gets two stars is the service we had and the fact that the drinks are strong.   I went here this past weekend and although my server was on top of his game, I didn't enjoy anything any one of us had.  A couple of us had salads - blah.  Really there was nothing special about them.  The chicken was cold even though it was supposed to be grilled, the onion rings on my salad were also served cold and the size was on the smaller side even though it was dinner.  The burgers were OK but nothing worth coming back for again.  Those were also served cold.  The fries were fine.  You would think they were super busy but they were DEAD so there was really no reason to get cold food. Overall, unless you come here to get tipsy for their happy hour, go somewhere else for if you are looking for quality food.

Not my usual sort if place but the food is surprisingly good for an inexpensive and fun night out out with the family. Had the salmon and langoustine lobster, which was nicely done. Staff are very friendly and attentive. The balloon girl made my kids' night. We are definitely tempted to go back soon.

Was there last night for dinner.   Service was very  good or this review would have been 1 star.    My date and I shared the lobster and steak dinner.    Half of the 4 oz steak was gristle and the lobster was ok tasting but you needed to have a magnifying glass to see it.  Looked more like a crawdad.   The drawn butter was... well I don't know how to describe it....actually had to ask for it...but it was weird...cold and congealed something or other.   Trying to find something that was good....ok...yes the croutons on the Cesar salad were very good.    Maybe I just ordered the wrong thing!!!!

Joy to this hip family chain-restaurant! A place of fun and exciting lights that would inspire Athena!  My Syracuse roots are boiled alive by the fun young hostess and their flirty voices. How happy a man can be when the youth of a city are not being corrupted by Socrates and his questions.      Amazing are the appetizers and more  amazingly, a sphere of tasty Cobb salads here has 2/3 as much surface area as a cylinder of Jack Daniel's Burgers. As a side note it was a little embarrassing getting avocado in the beard!

There are two types of customers in this place. One is the drinking, appetizer type, social gathering, that welcomes a lot of noise and watches several screens with the sports of the day, while loud music keeps their energy levels up. Then there is the customer that wants to find a good place to eat, with good value and quality. For the first type T.G.I Friday's is possibly quite good, because you always see them laughing and shouting, happy as clams. For the eaters of this world, this place is in a Rapid Decline. Party of 4 went there yesterday, and I paid over $80 for what turned out to be a very mediocre outing. Food: Nachos $10.99, terribly presented, barely any chips, had to complain-got more, with dry chopped chicken, and barely anything else. On a positive note: jalapeños were fresh. 2 Stars. Flat Bread with Spinach and Tomatos, not too shabby, small for the moola, $7.99. 3.5 Stars. Beer Cheese Hamburger with fries $9.99. Nothing to write home about it, just a run of the mill burger, obviously not their forte! 2.5 Stars. Two Cajun Pasta with Chicken, 2 for $20 menu, a gobbly mess that one of the eater liked and the other started laughing uncontrollably once her plate arrived, did not finish it. 3 Stars. Sizzling Chicken & Shrimp $14.99. The chicken was not chicken, but a highly processed patty, I suppose very efficient for this type of place but lacking the delicious characteristics chicken is known for. The Shrimp smothered in a very cheap tasting marinara sauce, and two mounds of disgusting mashed potatoes, with melted cheese that had hardened to the point of no return on the side, sad spectacle, not recommended to anyone who values their digestion process. 1.5 Stars. Coffee was good, at the tune of $2.59 each. Service was sad but server was very pretty, and we tend to overlook weaknesses a little bit, and after all it was not her fault what was served. This is not a place for quality eating. On the other hand I am sure one can get seriously tipsy knowing the place offers all manners of libations. For Booze, okey. For Food, No! Last ever visit, and strongly point out that the state of food in this area is getting worst, takes a lot of misses to sometimes find a decent place. 2 Stars.

Server was just lovely, but boy did she have her work cut out for her.  I am really  hoping that the children that were there had some kind of a mental health issue, because if they dont and their parents just allow that kind of behaviour I feel so sorry for them.  Food was quite good for a chain restaurant.  Boy my nerves were jangled by the time we left.  Not the restaurant's fault!

It's a TGI McFunsters, so it has every thing you'd expect from one... That is if you expectations were low. I don't know what it is about this particular local, but chain food here just kinda seems to suck even more - the servers don't seem to be happy here, there's a lack of esprit de corps among the staff, the bartenders seem kinda blas and uninspired. The food, at least here, is rather blah and uninspired. I mean, I've had good food at a TGI before, but maybe that was then and this is now. Whatever the case, all the food I've had here was textbook for what it should be; Not exemplary or outstanding, but not wretching either. It's food rather than a meal.
Could improve a lot if they didn't serve tap water with tap water ice. 5 gallons only cost a buck retail.

My first time at TGI Fridays. I didn't have great expectations walking into this place, but I came here more for the people I was there with. I ordered the sirloin salad. The flavor wasn't too bad. The only thing I would do different is put the dressing on the side. The portion wasn't that big. However, since I wasn't that hungry it was the perfect size. Another thing I didn't consider was that when red meat cools down, the fat gets to a really thick and pasty consistency. It happened with the salad. The meat came out warm, which was nice, but when it cooled down it was not so nice. I really liked the flavor of the dressing I also tried a breadstick. It was pretty good. It's not like an Olive Garden or Pat & Oscars baked breadstick. Rather, it's crispy on the outside because it's fried (or at least I think it's fried). It reminds me of a Chinese donut, the more dense kind. Overall, I think it was a fairly nice meal, but not great. Just a-ok.

Typical T.G.I. Friday's location. It was a slow afternoon, actually surprised me how slow this location was during lunch.   Shared a Jack Daniels appetizer sampler.  As a fan of JD I had high expectations and they where meet.  Would order this again! Service was above average, probably so good being we where the only ones in the waiters area.   This location has a typical layout. Parking is everywhere, so no need to stalk people coming out of the restaurant.  Only reason I give 4 stars vs 5 is that it needs to upgraded slightly and also needs an ATM machine at or near the bar.

I have such a love-hate relationship with this place.  I'm pretty sure it's only popular because it's open late and serves a little alcohol.  Otherwise, it has little going for it - long waits, mediocre service, boring food, tiny parking lot.  It's TGI Fridays, for goodness' sake!   I do get a little sad when I see a wholesome family stuck eating cheese-covered steaks in the meat market that is this TGI Fridays on any night after 7pm.  All they wanted was a good time and their appetizer and dessert included for one low price!  Do try the raspberry-cherry margarita... it was like drinking candy!

I used to come here every Wednesday for their $5 mudslides. However, the last two times I went, my friend and I found out they no longer offer deals on certain drinks depending on the day of the week. Furthermore, you can no longer get a mudslide on sale... ever. Their happy hour mixed drinks are extremely limited (I think they have three on their menu), and I don't like any of them. I am very disappointed that I can no longer get my favorite drink there (of coarse, I still could if I paid $8, but I would never pay that high of a price for a drink). My friends and I have all rotated to Dave and Busters in Irvine. They offer $3 mudslides during their happy hour. The only reason I am not giving lower stars is because I still think TGIF offers great deals on their food. Their 2 for $20 is great. I would have given 5 stars if they still offered their mudslides for happy hour. But alas, I guess the economy is hitting these guys too.

Beware of overcharging at TGI Fridays!  First, Kudo's to TGI for their effort to stimulate business with their stellar coupons -- namely BOGO entrees. In this economy, it is a welcome attention getter and a sure fire way to drive business to the restaurant. However, the restaurant backfires this positive by training their staff (which I assume they do) to create extra charges where they shouldn't exist. Example:  Just went there tonight to take advantage of a BOGO offer.  I clearly put my coupon on the table and informed the server (Felix) of our coupon. We then placed our order, of which one entree was a chicken dish with 2 sides. My friend clearly asked the server if he could get one of the published sides and a side salad instead of a second published side. The server said "yes, no problem." The server never mentioned an extra charge for the switch. He then asked my friend what he wanted on his baked potato, of which the answer was  "no sourcream and no chives." Bottom line: When the bill came, not only was the second entree amount not deleted, but there was charge for the side salad and a charge for the "cheese" that was apparently put on the potato. If a side salad carries an extra charge because it's not one of the items listed, then fine, but it is incumbent upon the server to state this extra charge, which is protocol in any restaurant I have ever been in. Normally, people would not even blink at the extra charge if this is what they want and they are informed of it, but to not say anything and then spring it on someone, no matter how minor the charge is, is not right and is un-American. We don't like this tactic and take offense to it! Also, the server, when questioned about the extra "cheese charge" got defensive, and said "you said you didn't want sour cream and chives, but you said nothing about cheese" -- well, this is just plain ridiculous. It's like Clinton saying he didn't have sex in the Oval Office, while in fact he did have oral sex but not traditional sex -- just a matter of semantics. So they charged for the side salad (unannounced), they charged for cheese on the baked potato, though they made no mention of this extra charge, they charged for the 2nd entree though it was free with the coupon; they then defensively questioned who took the coupon, even though it was their own employee -- do these people get Marketing 101? Coupons are to encourage good will, loyalty, trial, etc., not to antagonize the existing customers, which cost an arm and a leg to capture in the first place. TGI needs to get with the program and discourage their employees to practice deceptive practices to ring up a few extra bucks. If they are unaware of what I have described, then they need to look into this because I have better things to do than to waste my time on false reports. If they are aware of the deceptive practices, then shame on them. Either way, cut the crap, understand marketing, and don't let marketing efforts turn customers off instead of the desired goal, which is encouraging new customers, keeping current customers, etc.  Enough said.

I just got back from this place.  While I thought the food was okay.  The service was unacceptable.  My girlfriend is a New England Patriots fan (I guess we can't all be perfect) so she wanted to watch the game.  We asked to sit at the bar which was no problem for the host.  He told us that we had menus on the table.  Got there.  No menus.  5 minutes later the bartender girl comes by and asks what she can get started.  I ask if we can see the menu.  She asks what drinks we want.  I ask if I could see what they had to drink on the menu.  She gave us the menu and walked away.  10 minutes later we decide what we want to drink and what we want to eat.  I move one plate and give it to my girlfriend and on the plate that was for me was a little green gold.  That's right, a booger.  It was pretty gross.  Like I said my food wasn't bad.  I ordered crab cakes which weren't as well done as I'd like but the sauce was really good, but when it came time for our check the bartender/server couldn't even trouble herself enough to bring us our check.  She set the check on the bar and said, this is you guys.  It's not a far walk or hard or anything, but when you're at a sit down restaurant, you shouldn't have to stand up unless you're going to the bathroom or leaving.

i would say this place is like the mcdonald's of 'family restaurants'....&family restaurant type of chains like this tend to know what they're doing. they have fatty salty palette-pleasing (&a lot of deep-fried) foods on the menu that everyone will like plus a huge bar&dessert menu for kids. &orange county only has smooth roads, costcos, fish tacos, &TGI fridays anyway.....

I went here after the Super Bowl. It was dead, yet the service was horrible. It look over an hour for our food to get to us and it was cold. The server basically ignored us and he would hand us our drinks. Come on buddy, please place it on the table. He said that there's only one cook, yet there's so customers so our food should come out quicker. we were over charged. I got the manager out and he fixed the problem plus we got free coupons for appetizers. I don't know if I'd come back to this location, but I can't stay away from the Jack Daniel shrimp or sauce.

Just stayed for drinks, so I can't comment on the food. Received a friendly greeting upon entering and the same from the bar staff. The drinks seemed to pack enough punch and the barstools fit my backside perfectly. What more could I ask for? It seems like a young late night crowd rolls in at around midnight on Thursdays. Did I just say "rolls in"? That'll be as hip as my lingo gets.
